intro: Heptantra phalerata, commonly known as the Phalerate heptantra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, triangular leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Heptantra phalerata is typically found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
